vulnerability_findings.name: use-multiple-require
vulnerability_findings.message: Using multiple require statements is cheaper than using && multiple check combinations. There are more advantages, such as easier to read code and better coverage reports.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-short-revert-string
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(newOwner != address(0), "Ownable: new owner is the zero address");
vulnerability_findings.message: Shortening revert strings to fit in 32 bytes will decrease gas costs for deployment and  gas costs when the revert condition has been met.

vulnerability_findings.name: constant-function
vulnerability_findings.message: Address.isContract (bVaultETH.sol#208-214) is declared view but contains assembly code

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-no-eth
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in bVault.withdrawETH (bVaultETH.sol#390-413):
	External calls:
	- r = (balance().mul(_shares)).div(totalSupply()) (bVaultETH.sol#391)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- _totalSupply (bVaultETH.sol#392)

vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: constructor (string memory name, string memory symbol, uint8 decimals) public {
vulnerability_findings.message:
ERC20Detailed.constructor.name (local variable @ bVaultETH.sol#146) shadows:
	- ERC20Detailed.name (function @ bVaultETH.sol#151-153)

vulnerability_findings.name: shadowing-local
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: constructor (string memory name, string memory symbol, uint8 decimals) public {

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-benign
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in bVault.depositETH (bVaultETH.sol#366-384):
	External calls:
	- _pool = balance() (bVaultETH.sol#367)
	- _before = IERC20(weth).balanceOf(address(this)) (bVaultETH.sol#368)
	- WETH(address(weth)).deposit.value(_amount)() (bVaultETH.sol#370)
	- _after = IERC20(weth).balanceOf(address(this)) (bVaultETH.sol#371)
	External calls sending eth:
	- WETH(address(weth)).deposit.value(_amount)() (bVaultETH.sol#370)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- _balances (bVaultETH.sol#379)
	- _totalSupply (bVaultETH.sol#379)
	- userDepoistTime (bVaultETH.sol#380)

vulnerability_findings.name: reentrancy-benign
vulnerability_findings.message:
Reentrancy in bVault.withdrawETH (bVaultETH.sol#390-413):
	External calls:
	- r = (balance().mul(_shares)).div(totalSupply()) (bVaultETH.sol#391)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- _balances (bVaultETH.sol#392)
